Sentencas: This work investigates the thermodynamic analysis of syngas production from several fuels by steam reforming or dry reforming for SOFC-integrated systems.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: Four commonly used fuels are considered: methanol and glycerol (alcohols), methane, and diesel (hydrocarbons).
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: The integrated system is modeled on Aspen Plus using the Gibbs free energy minimization method and a generic electrochemical model to assess the effect of critical parameters on system performance.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: The results indicate a carbon-free zone within the reformer, and alcohols provide better resistance to carbon deposition than hydrocarbon fuels.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: Elevating the reforming temperature and STCR/CTCR increases the hydrogen concentration of syngas while also avoiding carbon deposits in the external reformer.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: Increasing the temperature and fuel utilization factor of SOFCs has been found to enhance electrical efficiency but at the expense of diminished thermal and total efficiency.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: For given operating conditions, the electrical efficiencies of methanol, glycerol, methane, and diesel are observed to be 47%, 46%, 51%, and 49% for the SRSOFC system, and 45%, 42%, 42%, and 33% for the DR-SOFC system, respectively.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: The methane-SR-SOFC and methanol-DR-SOFC systems have the highest electrical efficiency, while diesel is unsuitable for the DR-SOFC system.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels

Sentencas: This work can advise engineers to select the appropriate fuel types and reform technologies for SOFCintegrated systems.
Titulo: Thermodynamic performance comparison of a SOFC system integrated with steam reforming and dry reforming by utilizing different fuels
